<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_bus"><span class="unitcode">MKX4080</span> - Advanced business research methods<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">6 points, SCA Band 3, 0.125 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-MKX4080">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_bus">Undergraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-bus.html">Business and Economics</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Organisational Unit</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byou-department-of-marketing.html">Department of Marketing</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Chief examiner(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Yelena Tsarenko">Associate Professor Yelena Tsarenko</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Coordinator(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Yelena Tsarenko">Associate Professor Yelena Tsarenko</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Unit guides</p>
<ul>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=MKX4080&amp;tpCode=S1-01&amp;tpYear=2019">First semester</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble " id="preamble-MKX4080">
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<div class="hbk-preamble-icon hbk-preamble-icon_mode"></div>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Offered</p>
<p><a href="index-bylocation-caulfield.html">Caulfield</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>First semester 2019 (On-campus split block of classes)</li></ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Co-requisites</p>
<p>Students must be enrolled in course B3701 or B6010.</p>
</div>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>An in-depth introduction to the critical thinking and planning required in the initial stages of a thesis or research project. This unit will focus on the development of research proposal, research model, data analysis and interpretation of results.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>The learning goals associated with this unit are to:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>develop an understanding of how to formulate a theoretical framework for a marketing problem/opportunity</li>
<li>provide an understanding and appreciation of quantitative research techniques</li>
<li>provide an understanding of how to conduct data analysis</li>
<li>develop a comprehensive research report</li>
<li>develop a capability of communicating research findings.</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<p>Within semester assessment: 100%</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>Minimum total expected workload to achieve the learning outcomes for this unit is 144 hours per semester typically comprising a mixture of scheduled learning activities and independent study.  Independent study may include associated readings, assessment and preparation for scheduled activities. The unit requires on average three/four hours of scheduled activities per week. Scheduled activities may include a combination of teacher directed learning, peer directed learning and online engagement.</p><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<!-- /.content_container--> </div>
<!-- /.content-inner__main --></div>

<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_eng"><span class="unitcode">CIV5321</span> - Sustainable transportation systems planning<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">6 points, SCA Band 2, 0.125 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-CIV5321">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_eng">Postgraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-eng.html">Engineering</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Organisational Unit</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byou-department-of-civil-engineering.html">Department of Civil Engineering</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Chief examiner(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Jeff Walker">Professor Jeff Walker</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Coordinator(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Geoff Rose">Professor Geoff Rose</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Unit guides</p>
<ul>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=CIV5321&amp;tpCode=T3-57&amp;tpYear=2019">Term 3</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble " id="preamble-CIV5321">
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<div class="hbk-preamble-icon hbk-preamble-icon_mode"></div>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Offered</p>
<p><a href="index-bylocation-suzhou.html">Suzhou</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>Term 3 2019 (On-campus)</li></ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prerequisites</p>
<p>none</p>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Co-requisites</p>
<p>none</p>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prohibitions</p>
<p>none</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="notes">
<p class="hbk-heading hdg_6">Notes</p>
<p></p><p>This unit is only available to students enrolled in the double award Master International/Master of Transportation Systems with South East University, China.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>This unit introduces students to contemporary issues in planning for sustainable transport. Extensive use is made of case studies, practice exercises and practical 'real world' problems to reinforce the relevance of the material to contemporary professional practice. The concept of sustainable transport is introduced along with the steps in the transport planning process. Supply and demand oriented approaches to addressing transport challenges are reviewed and travel demand management is placed into context. The characteristics of transport modes and travel demand patterns are used to provide a framework for considering the suitability of a particular transport mode for a particular context. Travel survey methods are considered with an emphasis on the role of survey design and administration in the collection of useful travel survey data.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>After completing this unit students will be able to:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>critique the framework within which transport planning is conducted and the foundations upon which transport policy is formulated</li>
<li>appraise the range of supply and demand-oriented solutions which can be used to address transport and associated environmental problems within a sustainability context</li>
<li>judge the suitability of alternative methodologies for conducting transport surveys</li>
<li>critique transport surveys on the basis of their sample design, questionnaire design and survey administration</li>
<li>analyse contemporary issues in transportation planning and policy and assess the suitability of different policy options.</li>
<li>demonstrate effective written and oral cummunication skills</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<p>Assignments: 50%</p>
<p>Examination (2 hours): 50%</p>
<p>Students must pass both components</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>150 hours study</p><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">This unit applies to the following area(s) of study</h2>
<div>
<p>Civil Engineering</p>
</div>
<!-- /.content_container--> </div>
<!-- /.content-inner__main --></div>

</li>
<li class="breadcrumbs__item">
<a class="breadcrumbs__link" href="https://www.monash.edu/study">Study</a>
<span aria-hidden="true" class="breadcrumbs__divider">|</span>
</li>

</ul>
</nav>
<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_arts"><span class="unitcode">ATS2145</span> - Japanese proficient 1<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">6 points, SCA Band 1, 0.125 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-ATS2145">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_arts">Undergraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-arts.html">Arts</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Organisational Unit</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byou-japanese-studies.html">Japanese Studies</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Chief examiner(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Naomi Kurata">Dr Naomi Kurata</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Coordinator(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Naomi Kurata">Dr Naomi Kurata</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Unit guides</p>
<ul>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=ATS2145&amp;tpCode=S1-01&amp;tpYear=2019">First semester</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble " id="preamble-ATS2145">
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<div class="hbk-preamble-icon hbk-preamble-icon_mode"></div>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Offered</p>
<p><a href="index-bylocation-clayton.html">Clayton</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>First semester 2019 (On-campus)</li></ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prerequisites</p>
<p>Japanese intermediate 2 or equivalent</p>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prohibitions</p>
<p><span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/ATS3145.html">ATS3145</a></span></p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="notes">
<p class="hbk-heading hdg_6">Notes</p>
<p></p><p>If this is your language entry point, this unit requires a <a class="hbk-screen-url" href="http://www.monash.edu/arts/language-entry-level/">language entry level test</a><span class="hbk-print-url">language entry level test (<a href="http://www.monash.edu/arts/language-entry-level/">http://www.monash.edu/arts/language-entry-level/</a>)</span>.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>This is the first part of a sequence in upper intermediate Japanese. This unit covers both spoken language and contemporary written language and aims to enhance students' knowledge about Japan and the different varieties of the language. The unit also aims to develop students' study skills and intercultural competence.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>Upon successful completion of the unit, students will be able to:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>use listening skills to understand simple conversations as well as unfamiliar vocabulary and grammar;</li>
<li>read texts (approx. 1500 characters) written for upper intermediate level of students with the assistance of dictionaries;</li>
<li>use appropriate speech styles and communication strategies for a variety of contexts of different Japanese language, in order to communicate more naturally;</li>
<li>discuss various topics related to Japan;</li>
<li>write a short essay (800-1000 characters using online language resources effectively;</li>
<li>use kanji acquired so far (approx. 300 kanji) and recognise and begin to use additional 150 new kanji (including approx. 70 for recognition only).</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<p>Within semester assessment: 70% + Exam: 30%</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>Minimum total expected workload to achieve the learning outcomes for this unit is 144 hours per semester typically comprising a mixture of scheduled learning activities and independent study. A unit requires on average three/four hours of scheduled activities per week. Scheduled activities may include a combination of teacher directed learning, peer directed learning and online engagement.</p><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">This unit applies to the following area(s) of study</h2>
<div>
<p><a href="../aos/japanese-studies">Japanese studies</a></p>
</div>
<!-- /.content_container--> </div>
<!-- /.content-inner__main --></div>

<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_ada"><span class="unitcode">DGN5103</span> - Design practice as research<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">6 points, SCA Band 1, 0.125 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-DGN5103">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_ada">Postgraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-ada.html">Art, Design and Architecture</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Organisational Unit</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byou-department-of-design.html">Department of Design</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Chief examiner(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Vince Dziekan">Dr Vince Dziekan</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Coordinator(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Vince Dziekan">Dr Vince Dziekan</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Unit guides</p>
<ul>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=DGN5103&amp;tpCode=S1-01&amp;tpYear=2019">First semester</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=DGN5103&amp;tpCode=S2-01&amp;tpYear=2019">Second semester</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=DGN5103&amp;tpCode=T2-58&amp;tpYear=2019">Trimester 2</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=DGN5103&amp;tpCode=T3-58&amp;tpYear=2019">Trimester 3</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble " id="preamble-DGN5103">
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<div class="hbk-preamble-icon hbk-preamble-icon_mode"></div>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Offered</p>
<p><a href="index-bylocation-caulfield.html">Caulfield</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>First semester 2019 (On-campus)</li><li>Second semester 2019 (On-campus)</li></ul><p><a href="index-bylocation-prato.html">Prato</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>Trimester 2 2019 (<a href="index-bymode-off-campus.html">Off-campus block of classes</a>)</li><li>Trimester 3 2019 (<a href="index-bymode-off-campus.html">Off-campus block of classes</a>)</li></ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prerequisites</p>
<p>Enrolment in a Design Honours degree or Master of Design (F6002), or by permission.</p>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prohibitions</p>
<p><span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/MDC5340.html">MDC5340</a></span></p>
</div>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>Design Practice as Research provides a platform for students to apply a range of skills and aptitudes towards practice-based research in design. Through an individualised course of study under the guidance of personal research mentors, participants will undertake projects using appropriate methodologies that demonstrate an independent point of view on the social, cultural, technological, and communicative aspects of design. The unit will enhance the combined creative and analytical methods of students as preparation for undertaking practice-based research while also promoting how processes of research and development can make an advanced contribution to contemporary design practice. The unit provides a unique opportunity for establishing interdisciplinary approaches to design research and the intersection of theory and practice. On occasion, these studies may be undertaken as part of an immersive research studio conducted as part of special projects and study abroad experiences.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>Upon successful completion of this unit students will be able to:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>Understand advanced aspects of design research;</li>
<li>Critically analyse and evaluate dimensions of design (as cultural practice, studio research, applied research);</li>
<li>Apply advanced methods and strategies involved in practice-based design research (including disciplinary, interdisciplinary, transdisciplinary);</li>
<li>Apply designerly processes that result in the creation and communication of design research outcomes;</li>
<li>Plan and produce a project with a high degree of independence, originality, accountability and (if relevant) collaboration with other parties and stakeholders;</li>
<li>Communicate in an effective manner for the stated purpose, intended audience and designated context of the project;</li>
<li>Understand and apply the occupational health and safety requirements appropriate to the discipline practice.</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<p>100% in-semester assessment</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>The unit will be delivered through on campus and block modes; overall study plan is based on equivalence of 144hrs (12 hours per week x 12-week semester), composed of supervision and contact hours (36 hrs, or 3 hours per week) plus independent study (108 hrs, or 9 hours per week).</p><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<!-- /.content_container--> </div>
<!-- /.content-inner__main --></div>

<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_ada"><span class="unitcode">DWG1201</span> - Drawing 1<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">6 points, SCA Band 1, 0.125 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-DWG1201">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_ada">Undergraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-ada.html">Art, Design and Architecture</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Organisational Unit</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byou-department-of-fine-art.html">Department of Fine Art</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Chief examiner(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Leslie Eastman">Dr Leslie Eastman</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Coordinator(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Leslie Eastman">Dr Leslie Eastman</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Unit guides</p>
<ul>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=DWG1201&amp;tpCode=S1-01&amp;tpYear=2019">First semester</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble " id="preamble-DWG1201">
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<div class="hbk-preamble-icon hbk-preamble-icon_mode"></div>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Offered</p>
<p><a href="index-bylocation-caulfield.html">Caulfield</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>First semester 2019 (On-campus)</li></ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prerequisites</p>
<p>Students must be enrolled in a course owned, or, granted permission by, the Faculty of Art Design and Architecture</p>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prohibitions</p>
<p>DRW1201</p>
</div>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>An intensive program facilitating the acquisition and development of practical and intellectual skills required by art, design and architecture students in the discipline of drawing. Observation, analysis, selection, interpretation and expression are studied through sequential projects. Manufactured and natural forms including the figure and other models are central to the investigation of proportion, structure, volume and space through line, tone, shape, movement and texture. A range of drawing materials and methods are explored.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>Upon successful completion of this unit students will be able to:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>Produce artworks to represent objects, expressing their proportion, form and volume whilst displaying a basic grasp of structure;</li>
<li>Understand the relationships between the formal elements of drawing, including line, tone and shape and the relationships between these as they are incorporated within compositional dynamics;</li>
<li>Be critically aware of the need for selectivity and identifying visual prejudice;</li>
<li>Analyse the processes of perception and critically consider drawing in relation to observational objectivity;</li>
<li>Explore the historical, theoretical, philosophical and aesthetic contexts of drawing;</li>
<li>Understand and apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to the discipline practice.</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<p>100% in-semester assessment</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>12 hours per week including 4 contact hours plus 8 hours of independent study.</p><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<!-- /.content_container--> </div>
<!-- /.content-inner__main --></div>

<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_med"><span class="unitcode">NUR3310</span> - Translation of nursing knowledge to complex acute care practice<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">12 points, SCA Band 1, 0.250 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-NUR3310">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_med">Undergraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-med.html">Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Organisational Unit</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byou-school-of-nursing-and-midwifery.html">School of Nursing and Midwifery</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Chief examiner(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Tamsin Jones">Tamsin Jones</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Coordinator(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Noelleen Kiprillis">Ms Noelleen Kiprillis</a>
        
        (Clayton)
      
    <br/>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Amy Koenig">Amy Koenig</a>
        
        (Peninsula)
      
    <br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Unit guides</p>
<ul>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=NUR3310&amp;tpCode=S1-01&amp;tpYear=2019">First semester</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble " id="preamble-NUR3310">
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<div class="hbk-preamble-icon hbk-preamble-icon_mode"></div>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Offered</p>
<p><a href="index-bylocation-clayton.html">Clayton</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>First semester 2019 (On-campus)</li></ul><p><a href="index-bylocation-peninsula.html">Peninsula</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>First semester 2019 (On-campus)</li></ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prerequisites</p>
<p><span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/NUR2226.html">NUR2226</a></span> and <span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/NUR2228.html">NUR2228</a></span></p>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Co-requisites</p>
<p>Must be enrolled in M2006 or M3007</p>
</div>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>This unit builds on <span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/NUR2225.html">NUR2225</a></span>, <span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/NUR2226.html">NUR2226</a></span>, <span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/NUR2228.html">NUR2228</a></span> and <span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/NUR2229.html">NUR2229</a></span> introducing students to the nursing management of patients with complex and/or life threatening problems across the lifespan.</p>
<p>The unit will focus on the integration of advanced health assessment skills, clinical application of evidence-based practice and ethical principles in the management of complex nursing situations. Clinical judgement skills will be developed through the translation of knowledge involving the management of the deteriorating patient.</p>
<p>Pathophysiology, pharmacology, and healthcare interventions will be critically evaluated in the context of complex healthcare issues.</p>
<p>This approach will complement the extensive clinical experience that students will undertake during this unit. In simulated and actual clinical settings, students will apply diagnostic, therapeutic and preventative techniques associated with caring for a person with a complex body system health breakdown in a range of settings.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>Upon successful completion of the unit, students will:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>Apply knowledge of pathophysiological, psychological and psychosocial concepts to patients with complex and/or life threatening illness throughout the lifespan.</li>
<li>Demonstrate evidence-based knowledge of a range of complex health problems experienced by patients throughout the lifespan in a range of settings.</li>
<li>Identify and implement response systems for the deteriorating patient in the clinical setting.</li>
<li>Apply knowledge of appropriate therapeutic medications in terms of their mechanism of action, important aspects of pharmacokinetics, adverse effects, interactions and contraindications in the patient with complex and/or life threatening illness.</li>
<li>Demonstrate clinical judgement skills to identify, analyse and resolve clinical concerns in the patient with complex and/or life threatening illness.</li>
<li>Develop and implement patient-centred care appropriate to the needs and wishes of the patient and their family/carer, inclusive of race, age, gender, sexual preference, physical or mental state or other diverse needs.</li>
<li>Undertake complex nursing activities in a range of health settings, and apply appropriate principles of prioritising and time management appropriate to the clinical setting.</li>
<li>Critically reflect on decisions and judgements made to demonstrate accountability for informed patient care.</li>
<li>Practice with increasing dependence in accordance with the Australian Nursing and Midwifery Council (ANMAC) Professional Standards for the Registered Nurse, Codes of ethics and Code of professional conduct for nurses.</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Fieldwork</h2>
<div>
<p>Clinical placement (200 hours) Hurdle</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<ul>
<li>iSAP Case Study (20%)</li>
<li>On-line simulation scenario (10%)</li>
<li>Written examination (3 hours) (40%) Hurdle</li>
<li>Clinical Placement (200 hours) (30%) Hurdle</li>
</ul>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>On-campus: 7 weeks on-campus: 2-hour workshop each week and 2-hour clinical learning environment (CLE) each week.</p>
<p>Off-campus: 200 hours of clinical placement (40 hours per fortnight)</p>
<p>Private study: 84 hours (7 hours per week)</p>
<p>Total 312 hours</p><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">This unit applies to the following area(s) of study</h2>
<div>
<p><a href="../aos/nursing">Nursing</a></p>
<p><a href="../aos/nursing-and-midwifery">Nursing and midwifery</a></p>
</div>

<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_sci"><span class="unitcode">ASP5021</span> - Advanced astrophysics coursework B<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">12 points, SCA Band 2, 0.250 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-ASP5021">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_sci">Postgraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-sci.html">Science</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Organisational Unit</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byou-school-of-physics-and-astronomy.html">School of Physics and Astronomy</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Chief examiner(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Michael J Morgan">Professor Michael J Morgan</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Coordinator(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Michael J Morgan">Professor Michael J Morgan</a>
<br/>
</p>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble " id="preamble-ASP5021">
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<div class="hbk-preamble-icon hbk-preamble-icon_mode"></div>
<p>Not offered in 2019</p>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prerequisites</p>
<p>Enrolment in the Master of Science</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="notes">
<p class="hbk-heading hdg_6">Notes</p>
<p></p><p>The unit will be offered annually from Semester 1, 2020 in a non-standard teaching period</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>Students undertake advanced studies in three selected topics in physics and related fields.</p>
<p>These extend the expertise in theoretical and computational physics, data analysis and the skills required to effectively communicate their findings using contemporary communication tools.</p>
<p>The topics are:</p>
<p>Advanced statistical mechanics and critical phenomena</p>
<p>Advanced condensed matter physics - Part B</p>
<p>Advanced quantum information theory and quantum computation</p>
<p>Quantum fluids and many-body theory</p>
<p>X-ray optics and synchrotron science</p>
<p>NB: Subject to approval by the Chief Examiner, one of the topics in <span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/PHS5021.html">PHS5021</a><span class="unitoffered">Not offered in 2019</span></span> may be replaced by a topic from ASP5021.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>On completion of this unit students will be able to:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>Demonstrate an understanding of advanced theoretical and computational physics, and related disciplines.</li>
<li>Demonstrate high-level skills in theoretical/computation physics and/or experimental physics that are essential for advanced contemporary physics.</li>
<li>Synthesize and interpret advanced knowledge in theoretical, computational and/or experimental physics.</li>
<li>Apply knowledge and critical thinking skills to the solution of complex problems in contemporary physics.</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<p>Examinations (2 hours): 50%</p>
<p>Tests: 20%</p>
<p>Assignments: 30%</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>A total of 24 hours per week</p>
<ul>
<li>3 three-hours of lectures/workshops/tutorials per week</li>
<li>Three hours of consultation and online discussions involving peers and staff</li>
<li>12 hours of independent study per week</li>
</ul><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">This unit applies to the following area(s) of study</h2>
<div>
<p>Master of Science in Astrophysics</p>
</div>
<!-- /.content_container--> </div>
<!-- /.content-inner__main --></div>

<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_med"><span class="unitcode">NUR5218</span> - Advanced clinical decision making<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">12 points, SCA Band 1, 0.250 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-NUR5218">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_med">Postgraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-med.html">Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Organisational Unit</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byou-school-of-nursing-and-midwifery.html">School of Nursing and Midwifery</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Chief examiner(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Vanessa Clothier">Vanessa Clothier</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Coordinator(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Vanessa Clothier">Vanessa Clothier</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Unit guides</p>
<ul>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=NUR5218&amp;tpCode=S1-01&amp;tpYear=2019">First semester</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=NUR5218&amp;tpCode=S2-01&amp;tpYear=2019">Second semester</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble " id="preamble-NUR5218">
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<div class="hbk-preamble-icon hbk-preamble-icon_mode"></div>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Offered</p>
<p><a href="index-bylocation-clayton.html">Clayton</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>First semester 2019 (Flexible)</li><li>Second semester 2019 (Flexible)</li></ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prerequisites</p>
<p><span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/NUR5208.html">NUR5208</a></span>, <span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/NUR5411.html">NUR5411</a></span>.</p>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Co-requisites</p>
<p>Must be enrolled in course M6006.</p>
</div>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>This unit further extends the students' knowledge and skills relating to the clinical reasoning process to enable them to plan and implement evidence-informed interventions.</p>
<p>The unit requires students to analyse the clinical, cultural and professional factors that influence nurse practitioner clinical decision making.</p>
<p>The clinical skill development and consolidation will be supported through the provision of adequate and appropriate clinical practice in the context of the workplace setting. Students will be expected to work closely with their clinical mentors to achieve this.</p>
<p>The unit promotes a holistic model of care that includes recognition of and respect for cultural identity and lifestyle choices and how these factors can influence decision making.</p>
<p>The unit also provides an examination of contemporary professional issues that impact on nurse practitioner practice and inform the scope of the nurse practitioner role in specific practice areas.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>Upon successful completion of this unit, students should be able to:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>Apply extended skills in diagnostic reasoning to speciality nurse practitioner practice</li>
<li>Synthesise and interpret findings from clinical assessment and diagnostic tests to plan and implement appropriate, evidence-based preventive and/or therapeutic interventions</li>
<li>Design and develop a learning package targeting advanced clinical decision making relevant to speciality nurse practitioner practice</li>
<li>Implement sound clinical decisions that are cognisant of  the impact of social and cultural factors on the health of individuals and communities</li>
<li>Evaluate the specific health care needs of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and incorporate their cultural beliefs and practices into interactions and care planning</li>
<li>Implement  culturally safe nurse practitioner practice</li>
<li>Critically analyse the scope of nurse practitioner practice in a specific practice area and how it contributes to the organisation and the community</li>
<li>Explain the professional, legal and ethical responsibilities associated with the nurse practitioner role to stakeholders</li>
<li>Critically analyse clinical issues that support or complicate nurse practitioner practice</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Fieldwork</h2>
<div>
<p>Students must be employed for at least 2 days per week in an appropriate clinical environment cognisant with course objectives and have support to undertake extended clinical practice.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<ul>
<li>Online forum (1,200 words total) (10%)</li>
<li>Online quiz (weekly-online) (20%)</li>
<li>Written assignment (1,800 words) (15%)</li>
<li>Written case-study iSAP (25%)</li>
<li>Oral presentation 45 mins (30%)</li>
</ul>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>It is expected that students will undertake 25 hrs per week of online activities and self-directed learning.</p>
<p>This will consist of approximately 12 hours of self-directed learning and 12 hours teacher-directed learning per week.</p>
<p>Students are also expected to attend 4 contact days throughout the semester.</p><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Off-campus attendance requirements</h2>
<div>
<p></p><p>Residential school 2 - 3 days during the semester, 25 hours per week online activities and self-directed learning.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">This unit applies to the following area(s) of study</h2>
<div>
<p><a href="../aos/nursing">Nursing</a></p>
<p><a href="../aos/nurse-practitioner">Nurse practitioner</a></p>
</div>
<!-- /.content_container--> </div>

<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_med"><span class="unitcode">NUR2206</span> - Integrated nursing practice 2<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">12 points, SCA Band 1, 0.250 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-NUR2206">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_med">Undergraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-med.html">Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Organisational Unit</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byou-school-of-nursing-and-midwifery.html">School of Nursing and Midwifery</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Chief examiner(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Danny Hills">Dr Danny Hills</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Coordinator(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Angela Bradley">Ms Angela Bradley</a>
        
        (Clayton)
      
    <br/>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Robyn Fairhall">Dr Robyn Fairhall</a>
        
        (Peninsula)
      
    <br/>
</p>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble " id="preamble-NUR2206">
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<div class="hbk-preamble-icon hbk-preamble-icon_mode"></div>
<p>Not offered in 2019</p>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prerequisites</p>
<p>BMA1912, <span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/NUR2106.html">NUR2106</a><span class="unitoffered">Not offered in 2019</span></span>.</p>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Co-requisites</p>
<p>Must be enrolled in courses 0727 or 4514.</p>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prohibitions</p>
<p>NUR2004.</p>
</div>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>Using a lifespan approach this unit builds on semester one learning in <span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/NUR2106.html">NUR2106</a><span class="unitoffered">Not offered in 2019</span></span> and further explores the integration and application of pharmacological principles and associated drug groups underpinned by human pathophysiology related to the body system under review.</p>
<p>There will be an emphasis on the general paediatric population and commonly presenting conditions that relate specifically to this group.</p>
<p>Other systems that will be studied include musculoskeletal, gastroenterological, haematological, neurological and vascular conditions.</p>
<p>Clinical simulation exercises will be utilised in laboratory sessions to develop and enhance the acquisition of clinical skills.</p>
<p>The clinical practicum component provides opportunities to develop competency to a second year level in a range of skills learnt in the simulated laboratory environment.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>Upon successful completion of this unit, students should be able to:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>Demonstrate knowledge of pathophysiological changes associated with gastrointestinal, musculoskeletal, vascular, neurological and haematological dysfunction and their application to the nursing care of patients in medical/surgical contexts;</li>
<li>Recognise paediatric health issues relating to the respiratory and gastrointestinal systems, incorporating specific health assessment techniques;</li>
<li>Describe underpinning principles of pharmacology, therapeutic drug administration and monitoring as they relate to the patient;</li>
<li>Discuss possible implications associated with drug administration, including calculations for administering drugs to paediatric patients;</li>
<li>Describe the legal and professional nursing requirements associated with safe use of medications including administration, storage and handling;</li>
<li>Analyse problems associated with drug administration, including drug interactions and the use of drugs across the life-span;</li>
<li>Plan culturally relevant and age specific nursing interventions for acutely ill patients across the lifespan;</li>
<li>Critically discuss ethical issues relevant to the nursing care of patients requiring medical/surgical care;</li>
<li>Demonstrate safe, evidenced based clinical practice in an acute care setting based on integration of theoretical principles and practical skills;</li>
<li>Provide person-centred care according to relevant nursing care principles for patients, under the supervision of registered nursing staff and the clinical teacher;</li>
<li>Conduct and document comprehensive assessments of patient needs utilising an appropriate assessment tool; and</li>
<li>Reflect and evaluate self-performance in terms of the delivery of quality nursing care.</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Fieldwork</h2>
<div>
<p>Three (3) weeks of clinical placement at five (5) days/week (based on an 8 hour day/40 hour week, 120 hours in total).</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<ul>
<li>Five online Quizzes (20 minutes per quiz) (10%)</li>
<li>Written assignment - paired clinical case study assignment (3,000 words) (30%)</li>
<li>Examination (2 hours) (40% - Hurdle)</li>
<li>Clinical Placement - 3 weeks duration (120 hours)
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="A">
<li>Attendance &amp; Performance Evaluation (20 % - Hurdle)</li>
<li>Clinical Skills competencies (Pass/Fail - Hurdle)</li>
</ol></li>
<li>Medication Calculation Test (1 hour) (100% Mastery - Hurdle)</li>
<li>Laboratory attendance (Hurdle) (100% attendance)</li>
</ul>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>On campus learning (master classes, clinical learning environment and workshops): 40 hours</p>
<p>Online and self-directed activities: 80 hours</p>
<p>Three (3) weeks of clinical placement at five (5) days/week (based on an 8 hour day/40 hour week, 120 hours in total).</p>
<p>See also Unit timetable information: <a href="http://www.monash.edu/timetables">http://www.monash.edu/timetables</a></p><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">This unit applies to the following area(s) of study</h2>
<div>
<p><a href="../aos/nursing">Nursing</a></p>
<p><a href="../aos/nursing-and-midwifery">Nursing and midwifery</a></p>
</div>

<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_sci"><span class="unitcode">DEV3022</span> - Developmental and anatomical basis of human health and disease<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">6 points, SCA Band 2, 0.125 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-DEV3022">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_sci">Undergraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-sci.html">Science</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Chief examiner(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=John Bertram">Professor John Bertram</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Coordinator(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Sonja McKeown">Dr Sonja McKeown</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Unit guides</p>
<ul>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=DEV3022&amp;tpCode=S2-01&amp;tpYear=2019">Second semester</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble " id="preamble-DEV3022">
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<div class="hbk-preamble-icon hbk-preamble-icon_mode"></div>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Offered</p>
<p><a href="index-bylocation-clayton.html">Clayton</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>Second semester 2019 (On-campus)</li></ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prerequisites</p>
<p><span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/DEV3011.html">DEV3011</a></span></p>
</div>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>This unit considers the anatomy and development of the major organs and organ systems of the body. The classical morphogenetic steps/stages in organ development are described, as well as the most up to date knowledge of the molecular/genetic and foetal/maternal environmental regulation of these morphogenetic processes.  Organ systems covered include musculoskeletal, cardiovascular, central nervous, respiratory, gastrointestinal, renal and reproductive. Students will learn how abnormalities in genetic and/or environmental regulation of development lead to birth defects as well as chronic diseases in adulthood.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>On completion of this unit students will be able to:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>Describe the basic anatomy and development of the major organs and organ systems;</li>
<li>Analyse the genetic and environmental regulation of organogenesis in the major organ systems;</li>
<li>Explain how errors or perturbations in genetic and/or environmental regulation of development can lead to birth defects and outline how suboptimal development can result in or predispose to adult chronic disease;</li>
<li>Relate the relative contributions of endoderm, mesoderm and ectoderm in the formation of the tissues and organs of the adult body;</li>
<li>Demonstrate familiarity with experimental strategies and
techniques used to identify and study organogenesis and the regulation of organogenesis;</li>
<li>Demonstrate an ability to interpret, discuss and present studies in anatomy and developmental biology research.</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<p>Seminars: 30%</p>
<p>Practical reports: 20%</p>
<p>Examination (2 hours): 50% (Hurdle)</p>
<p>This unit is subject to the <a class="hbk-screen-url" href="http://www.med.monash.edu.au/policies/assessment-policy-2017.html">Hurdle and Threshold Standards policies</a><span class="hbk-print-url">Hurdle and Threshold Standards policies (<a href="http://www.med.monash.edu.au/policies/assessment-policy-2017.html">http://www.med.monash.edu.au/policies/assessment-policy-2017.html</a>)</span> of the Faculty of Medicine, Nursing &amp; Health Sciences.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>Two lectures and one three-hour practical class per week.</p><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">This unit applies to the following area(s) of study</h2>
<div>
<p><a href="../aos/developmental-biology">Developmental biology</a></p>
</div>
<!-- /.content_container--> </div>

<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_it"><span class="unitcode">FIT5109</span> - Research topic<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">6 points, SCA Band 2, 0.125 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-FIT5109">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_it">Postgraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-it.html">Information Technology</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Chief examiner(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Caddie Gao">Dr Caddie Gao</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Unit guides</p>
<ul>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=FIT5109&amp;tpCode=S1-01&amp;tpYear=2019">First semester</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=FIT5109&amp;tpCode=S2-01&amp;tpYear=2019">Second semester</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble " id="preamble-FIT5109">
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<div class="hbk-preamble-icon hbk-preamble-icon_mode"></div>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Offered</p>
<p><a href="index-bylocation-caulfield.html">Caulfield</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>First semester 2019 (On-campus)</li><li>Second semester 2019 (On-campus)</li></ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prerequisites</p>
<p>Completion of 24 points of graduate units from FIT.</p>
<p>Entry to this unit is subject to approval of the Associate Dean Education (ADE), on the advice of the relevant Masters Program Leader. An application form is required.</p>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prohibitions</p>
<p>IMS5037</p>
</div>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>This unit enables students to pursue a particular topic of research in the fields of information technology, information systems or information management. The research is done under supervision, and provides a chance for a student to pursue a topic of interest that has not been covered in other coursework units, or to build more in-depth knowledge in an area with which they already have some familiarity but desire more knowledge and expertise. Students enrolling in this unit should have the approval of the Head of School or their nominee. Assessment comprises a research paper, project report, or equivalent.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>At the completion of this unit, students will be able to:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>analyse, synthesise and construct arguments from a range of published sources;</li>
<li>critique and evaluate others' ideas, opinions and arguments;</li>
<li>explain ideas for scrutiny to a supervisor;</li>
<li>demonstrate self-reliance and time management skills in order to gain greater independence as a learner;</li>
<li>demonstrate the communication skills necessary to work effectively in a close, cooperative relationship with a supervisor;</li>
<li>assess the nature and demands of independent research.</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<p>Research paper, review, project report or equivalent: 100%</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>Minimum total expected workload equals 12 hours per week. Students are expected to hold regular meetings with supervisor(s) over the course of the semester.</p><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>

<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_arts"><span class="unitcode">APG4224</span> - Gender, violence and society: Criminal justice responses<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">6 points, SCA Band 1, 0.125 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-APG4224">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_arts">Postgraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-arts.html">Arts</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Organisational Unit</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byou-criminology.html">Criminology</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Chief examiner(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Kate Fitz-Gibbon">Dr Kate Fitz-Gibbon</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Coordinator(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Kate Fitz-Gibbon">Dr Kate Fitz-Gibbon</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Unit guides</p>
<ul>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=APG4224&amp;tpCode=SSA-02&amp;tpYear=2019">Summer semester A</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble " id="preamble-APG4224">
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<div class="hbk-preamble-icon hbk-preamble-icon_mode"></div>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Offered</p>
<p><a href="index-bylocation-clayton.html">Clayton</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>Summer semester A 2019 (Online)</li></ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prohibitions</p>
<p><span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/ATS3224.html">ATS3224</a></span></p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="notes">
<p class="hbk-heading hdg_6">Notes</p>
<p></p><p>The unit may be offered as part of the <a class="hbk-screen-url" href="http://www.monash.edu/students/courses/arts/summer-program.html">Summer Arts Program</a><span class="hbk-print-url">Summer Arts Program (<a href="http://www.monash.edu/students/courses/arts/summer-program.html">http://www.monash.edu/students/courses/arts/summer-program.html</a>)</span>.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>In this unit, students will examine key aspects of criminal justice response to gendered violence and relevant changes in policing and courts. Students will identify a specific area for sustained investigation. Focused on this area, students will undertake a targeted review of the relevant criminological academic literature and complete an independent research exercise.  This research will be supervised by the Unit Coordinator with input from other staff as appropriate.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>Upon successful completion of the unit, students will be able to:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>analyse and explain criminal justice responses to gendered family violence;</li>
<li>engage with a variety of critical and theoretical debates focused on legal responses to family violence;</li>
<li>identify and critically evaluate the extant literature about this issue;</li>
<li>differentiate and appraise a range of methodological approaches that have been used to police family violence;</li>
<li>communicate in both oral and written formats about this issue;</li>
<li>devise, prepare and complete a research project.</li>
<li>students at 4th year level will be able to self-determine the research process, demonstrating a higher level of rigour and discernment in their assessment tasks.</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<p>Within semester assessment: 100%</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>Minimum total expected workload to achieve the learning outcomes for this unit is 144 hours per semester typically comprising a mixture of scheduled learning activities and independent study. A unit requires on average three/four hours of scheduled activities per week. Scheduled activities may include a combination of teacher directed learning, peer directed learning and online engagement.</p><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">This unit applies to the following area(s) of study</h2>
<div>
<p><a class="hbk-screen-url" href="http://www.monash.edu.au/pubs/2019handbooks/courses/A6028.html">Master of Public Policy</a><span class="hbk-print-url">Master of Public Policy (<a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/pubs/2019handbooks/courses/A6028.html">http://www.monash.edu.au/pubs/2019handbooks/courses/A6028.html</a>)</span></p>
<p><a class="hbk-screen-url" href="http://www.monash.edu.au/pubs/2019handbooks/courses/A5005.html">Graduate Certificate of Family Violence Prevention</a><span class="hbk-print-url">Graduate Certificate of Family Violence Prevention (<a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/pubs/2019handbooks/courses/A5005.html">http://www.monash.edu.au/pubs/2019handbooks/courses/A5005.html</a>)</span></p>
<p><a class="hbk-screen-url" href="http://www.monash.edu.au/pubs/2019handbooks/courses/A5004.html">Graduate Diploma of Family Violence Prevention</a><span class="hbk-print-url">Graduate Diploma of Family Violence Prevention (<a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/pubs/2019handbooks/courses/A5004.html">http://www.monash.edu.au/pubs/2019handbooks/courses/A5004.html</a>)</span></p>
<p><a href="../aos/international-development-practice">International development practice</a></p>
</div>

<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_law"><span class="unitcode">LAW4165</span> - Comparative constitutions and rights<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">6 points, SCA Band 3, 0.125 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-LAW4165">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_law">Undergraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-law.html">Law</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Chief examiner(s)</p>
<p>
    
      
        Prof Marilyn Pittard <a class="hbk-screen-url" href="http://monash.edu/research/explore/en/persons/marilyn-pittard(585bd988-502f-43f7-961d-cd6344ac72d0).html">Researcher Profile</a><span class="hbk-print-url">Researcher Profile (<a href="http://monash.edu/research/explore/en/persons/marilyn-pittard(585bd988-502f-43f7-961d-cd6344ac72d0).html">http://monash.edu/research/explore/en/persons/marilyn-pittard(585bd988-502f-43f7-961d-cd6344ac72d0).html</a>)</span>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Unit guides</p>
<ul>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=LAW4165&amp;tpCode=T2-57&amp;tpYear=2019">Term 2</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble " id="preamble-LAW4165">
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<div class="hbk-preamble-icon hbk-preamble-icon_mode"></div>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Offered</p>
<p><a href="index-bylocation-prato.html">Prato</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>Term 2 2019 (On-campus)</li></ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prerequisites</p>
<p>LAW1100 OR LAW1101 and LAW1102 or LAW1104; LAW3200 or LAW3201</p>
</div>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>The unit will cover a series of topics arising in the comparative study of constitutional systems, mostly in the western-liberal tradition. Comparative constitutional law is a rapidly expanding and maturing field, embedded in a context of global spread of democratic models in the last half-century and the expansion of international human rights. The variety of constitutional models prevailing today will be examined and critiqued (among them the French system), including the structure of government (how countries are governed and political power is organised) and frameworks of human rights protection (how constitutions in democratic countries contribute to the effective protection of human rights).</p>
<p>Special attention will be devoted to issues such as:</p>
<ul>
<li>Constitutional stability and change in democratic regimes: aims, means, consequences of constitutional stability; constitutional customs, even contra legem; breach or disputable use of constitutional rules; means, usefulness and dangers of constitutional reviews; the "constitutional clean slate" (the choice of a democratically elected Constituent Assembly to produce an entirely new text).</li>
<li>Constitutions and religions: the place of religion in constitutional texts; the weight of religion in constitutional development as well as in constitutional and statutory interpretation.</li>
<li>Constitutions and minorities: reconciling majority and minority rights</li>
<li>Constitutions as a social/political project: Constitutions as guidelines for future public policy and development of human rights.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>Upon completion of this unit, students should:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="a">
<li>be able to apply knowledge and understanding of the various alternatives in the institutional design of the principal constitutional organs, and the advantages and disadvantages of each; as well as of the role of constitutions as a framework for protection of human rights in selected constitutional systems;</li>
<li>be able to formulate, investigate and critically consider key problems relating to the issues identified in the synopsis;</li>
<li>have further developed legal research and writing, and legal argument skills by undertaking systematic research into legal policy, rules and procedures and comparative perspectives relating to constitutional law and individual rights;</li>
<li>have developed skills of oral presentation, and participation in an interactive learning context, in relation to issues of legal policy, rules and arguments from the field of comparative constitutional law.</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<p>Malaysia attendance requirement: Students who fail to attend at least 80% of the classes in this unit (ie who miss 3 or more classes) will receive a result of 0 N for the unit. Students who are unable to meet this requirement due to severe illness or other exceptional circumstances must make an application for in-semester special consideration with supporting documentation.</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>Short paper (1,000 words): 20%</li>
<li>Take-home exam (3,000 words): 60%</li>
<li>Participation: 10%</li>
<li>Presentation: 10%</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>Students are required to attend 36 hours of lectures over the duration of this semi-intensive unit.</p>
<p>The unit timetable link below is not applicable to this unit.</p><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<!-- /.content_container--> </div>
<!-- /.content-inner__main --></div>

<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_med"><span class="unitcode">NUR5011</span> - Contemporary nursing in context 1<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">12 points, SCA Band 1, 0.250 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-NUR5011">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_med">Postgraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-med.html">Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Organisational Unit</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byou-school-of-nursing-and-midwifery.html">School of Nursing and Midwifery</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Chief examiner(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Roz Williamson">Roz Williamson</a>
        
        (Sem 1)
      
    <br/>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=ALison Hansen">ALison Hansen</a>
        
        (Sem 2)
      
    <br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Coordinator(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Roz Williamson">Roz Williamson</a>
        
        (Sem 1)
      
    <br/>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=ALison Hansen">ALison Hansen</a>
        
        (Sem 2)
      
    <br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Unit guides</p>
<ul>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=NUR5011&amp;tpCode=S1-01&amp;tpYear=2019">First semester</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=NUR5011&amp;tpCode=S2-01&amp;tpYear=2019">Second semester</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble " id="preamble-NUR5011">
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<div class="hbk-preamble-icon hbk-preamble-icon_mode"></div>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Offered</p>
<p><a href="index-bylocation-clayton.html">Clayton</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>First semester 2019 (On-campus)</li><li>Second semester 2019 (On-campus)</li></ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Co-requisites</p>
<p>Must be enrolled in one of the following course codes: 3966, M6016</p>
</div>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>This unit is the first of three units that examines nursing practice from a socio-political framework. In providing an understanding of fundamental concepts of nursing as a discipline, this unit introduces students to the disparate locations of nursing practice globally and allows for in-depth exploration of health care settings in the Australian health care milieu.</p>
<p>Students will study health care through a social model of health and will situate nursing care within this model. A history of nursing and the various opportunities and barriers that have influenced the development of nursing as a profession will be explored and debated.</p>
<p>The Australian legal system as its relationship to the health care environment will be examined and students will be required to explore the complex legal relationships that nurses have with patients, families and other health care professionals. In addition, professional and ethical codes will be introduced, explored and posited as a basis for professional nursing practice.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>Upon successful completion of this unit, students should be able to:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>Distinguish the evolution of contemporary nursing practice from both an international and Australian perspective.</li>
<li>Examine the multi-faceted health care system in Australia and how nurses practice in these settings.</li>
<li>Debate the socio-political influences on the development of nursing as a profession.</li>
<li>Identify and appraise ethical dilemmas that arise in health care and strategies for resolving these.</li>
<li>Evaluate the pertinent legal concepts and mechanisms that underpin the practice of nursing.</li>
<li>Utilize and incorporate legal and professional standards in the various practice environments.</li>
<li>Discuss common law and statute law relevant to professional practice.</li>
<li>Analyse the legal implications of actions taken in nursing practice.</li>
<li>Discuss and apply ethical theories relevant to nursing practice.</li>
<li>Explore ethical and legal aspects of end of life decision making.</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<ul>
<li>Active Learning Engagement (10%)</li>
<li>Online/ oral presentation (20%)</li>
<li>Written assignment (4,000 words) (35%)</li>
<li>Exam (3 hours) (35%)</li>
</ul>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>7 hours a week: lectures 4 hours, tutorials 1 hour, online learning activities 2 hours over a 14 week semester.</p><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">This unit applies to the following area(s) of study</h2>
<div>
<p><a href="../aos/nursing">Nursing</a></p>
<p>Nursing and midwifery</p>
</div>
<!-- /.content_container--> </div>
<!-- /.content-inner__main --></div>

<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_med"><span class="unitcode">NUR4113</span> - Translation of nursing knowledge for leadership in practice<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">12 points, SCA Band 1, 0.250 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-NUR4113">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_med">Undergraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-med.html">Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Organisational Unit</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byou-school-of-nursing-and-midwifery.html">School of Nursing and Midwifery</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Chief examiner(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Verity Mak">Verity Mak</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Coordinator(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Verity Mak">Ms Verity Mak</a>
        
        (Clayton)
      
    <br/>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Janet Wettenhall">Ms Janet Wettenhall</a>
        
        (Peninsula)
      
    <br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Unit guides</p>
<ul>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=NUR4113&amp;tpCode=S2-01&amp;tpYear=2019">Second semester</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble " id="preamble-NUR4113">
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<div class="hbk-preamble-icon hbk-preamble-icon_mode"></div>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Offered</p>
<p><a href="index-bylocation-clayton.html">Clayton</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>Second semester 2019 (On-campus)</li></ul><p><a href="index-bylocation-peninsula.html">Peninsula</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>Second semester 2019 (On-campus)</li></ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prerequisites</p>
<p><span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/NUR2223.html">NUR2223</a></span> and <span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/NUR4111.html">NUR4111</a></span></p>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Co-requisites</p>
<p>Enrolled in M2006</p>
</div>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>This unit builds on the concepts covered in core units in years one (1), two (2) and three (3).</p>
<p>The content is related to identifying areas of healthcare practice that require improvement, and how quality and safety frameworks and nursing leadership translates to safe and quality care.</p>
<p>This unit is offered in the final  semester of the course with <span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/NUR3312.html">NUR3312</a></span> Translation of nursing knowledge in preparation for professional nursing practice.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>Upon successful completion of this unit, students will be able to:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>Apply the Safety and Quality Improvement Framework in a variety of scenarios, using a person-centred approach;</li>
<li>Apply models of leadership and their contribution to the advancement of the profession, through the conduct of a quality improvement process;</li>
<li>Reflect on quality and patient safety outcomes drawn from clinical placement experience</li>
<li>Analyse the evidence for an identified area of nursing practice that would benefit from a quality improvement process;</li>
<li>Design a quality improvement program for an identified area of nursing practice;</li>
<li>Critically analyse literature and evidence supporting clinical and nursing practice</li>
<li>Evaluate the process of a clinical practice guideline development.</li>
<li>Appraise peer quality improvement programs using an evidence based evaluation tool</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<ul>
<li>Written report on Quality Improvement Issue (Individual) (3,000 words) (40%) (Hurdle)</li>
<li>Healthcare Innovation program (2,000 words) (25%)</li>
<li>Group poster presentation (1,500 words) (20%)</li>
<li>Masterclass (2 hours) Peer Evaluation and written reflection (15%) (Hurdle)</li>
</ul>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>7 weeks teacher directed activity: 2 x 2 hour workshops each week (80% attendance requirement hurdle)</p>
<p>MNM Quality Innovation Forum 2 hrs (one only) (attendance Hurdle)</p>
<p>This unit is run with an integrated clinical placement alongside <span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/NUR3312.html">NUR3312</a></span>.</p><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Off-campus attendance requirements</h2>
<div>
<p></p><p>Online teacher directed activities 10 hours each week</p>
<p>Self-Directed Learning 12 hours each week</p>
<p>Total 292 hours</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">This unit applies to the following area(s) of study</h2>
<div>
<p><a href="../aos/nursing">Nursing</a></p>
<p><a href="../aos/nursing-and-midwifery">Nursing and midwifery</a></p>
</div>
<!-- /.content_container--> </div>
<!-- /.content-inner__main --></div>
